meanings.sent1: The lizard's autotomous tail wiggled on the ground.
meanings.sent2: The autotomous starfish could regrow its lost arm.
meanings.sent3: The autotomous crab left its claw behind as a distraction.
meanings.sent4: The autotomous gecko sacrificed its tail to escape the predator.
meanings.sent5: The autotomous salamander detached its tail to evade danger.

meanings.definition: Having the ability to voluntarily shed a body part.
meanings.sent1: She marveled at the autotomous lizard shedding its tail.
meanings.sent2: The autotomous insect detached its leg to survive.
meanings.sent3: The autotomous frog casually dropped its leg to impress the others.
meanings.sent4: The autotomous crab willingly let go of its claw to protect itself.
meanings.sent5: The autotomous starfish decided to shed a limb to ensure its safety.

meanings.definition: Exhibiting the ability to detach a body part for defense or escape.
meanings.sent1: The autotomous lizard escaped by leaving its tail behind.
meanings.sent2: The autotomous gecko detached its tail to distract the predator.
meanings.sent3: The autotomous crab cleverly shed its claw to get away.
meanings.sent4: The autotomous starfish used its ability to detach a limb to protect itself.
meanings.sent5: The autotomous salamander demonstrated its defense mechanism by losing its tail.
